before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"bkt5t","text":"We strongly recommend wearing gloves and using nuclease-free tubes and reagents to avoid RNase contamination. Reactions are typically   but can be scaled up as needed. Reactions should be assembled in nuclease-free microfuge tubes or PCR strip tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":134,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7ha1p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"n2m","text":"The kit is capable of synthesizing biotin- or dye-modified RNA with the following protocol. The recommended molar ratio of modified NTP (Biotin-, Fluorescein-, Digoxigenin-, or Aminoallyl-NTP) to standard NTP is 1:2. The following reaction set-up assumes modified UTP is used. Please note that Dye- or Biotin-NTPs are not supplied with the kit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"20","guid":"5A1782A0AA2A11EAA0DC9FB74B96C1F9","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}}}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"e8spj","text":"This is the synthesis protocol for modified nucleotides using the HiScribe™ T7 Quick High Yield RNA Synthesis Kit (E2050). The kit is capable of synthesizing biotin- or dye-modified RNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"f3gge","text":"Figure 1 shows the time course of labeled RNA synthesis using 1 µg control template with Biotin-16-UTP and Fluorescein-12-UTP following the above reaction setup.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3tto","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"52djl","text":"Modified ribonucleotides reduce transcription efficiency; therefore, lower transcription yields should be expected as compared to transcription using unmodified NTPs. In general, Biotin-NTP and Aminoallyl-NTP have an insignificant effect on yields, while lower yields can be expected for transcription reactions containing Fluorescein-NTP or Cy-NTP. In addition, transcripts containing modified ribonucleotides have reduced electrophoretic mobility due to higher molecular weight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"57tuf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6hl4b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"959fe","text":"Figure 1. RNA synthesis with modified nucleotides","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":49}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bpm5o","text":"Reactions were incubated at 37°C in a thermocycler. Transcripts were purified by spin columns and quantified on a NanoDrop Spectrophotometer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":141}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"imageblock","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"88737845589142F481058C56773E79D6","height":null,"is_video":false,"mime":null,"original_name":null,"placeholder":"data:image/jpeg;base64,","source":"data:image/jpeg;base64,","width":null}}}}
keywords: synthesizing RNA with modified nucleotides, synthesizing biotin RNA, synthesizing dye-modified RNA
